titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) Gubernatorial records, Public Relations, Series 27
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, Public Relations, Series 27 FA369

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-05 02:11:19 -0500.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller gubernatorial records, Public Relations, Series 27

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Nelson A. Rockefeller served as governor of New York from January 1, 1959, to December 18, 1973. He was the first person elected to four consecutive four-year terms as a state governor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is divided into three subseries:
Subseries 1 - Books and Articles, 1960-1971 Subseries 2 - Speeches, 1960-1964 Subseries 3 - Campaign Material, 1958-1972

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: NOTE TO RESEARCHERS

This series contains a small portion of the office fils of Hugh Morrow. They document his official activities in the execution of his duties as a member of Nelson A. Rockefeller's gubernatorial staff. The actions, decisions, and exchanges of information or points of view documented here occurred in the course of proposing and implementing policies for the Rockefeller administration and political campaigns. However, unless a document is personally signed by Nelson A. Rockefeller, or is referred to in a document personally signed by him, it should not be assumed that he saw the document or was aware of its existence or substance. Furthermore, researchers should bear in mind that files may contain documents or drafts addressed to Rockefeller which were never shown to him.
SCOPE AND CONTENT

This series contains a small portion of the files of Hugh Morrow, who served as a speech writer and special assistant to Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller from November 1959 and was appointed Director of Communications on February 4, 1969.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of drafts and correspondence regarding articles either prepared by Rockefeller or written for him by Hugh Morrow and others. Published copies are included for most of the articles. However, some files do not indicate whether publication actually occurred.

There is correspondence on the production of three books by Nelson Rockefeller. They are "Unity, Freedom and Peace," Rockefeller's stand on various issues written for the 1968 presidential race; "Dear Mr. President," an unpublished book on foreign policy drafted by Rodney Campbell; and "Our Environment Can Be Saved," Rockefeller's 1970 strategy for saving the environment and supporting the arts. There are slim files on two other books: "The Future of Federalism," the book version of Rockefeller's 1962 talks at Harvard University's Godkin Lecture Series, and "The Real Rockefeller," Frank Gervasi's 1964 biography. There are no drafts for any of the manuscripts. Copies of the published books are found in the Archive Center (noncirculating) library collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts and correspondence re articles requested of NAR. Subjects include "Words to Live By"; how to keep peace in the Latin American family; fundamental American values; government service; favorite stories; Republican issues - Richard Peet and James Wills; 1964 strategy; today's issues (1964); Republican policy re Negroes; attack Goldwater; scientific research in New York.

scopecontent.p: Article by NAR; "The Importance of Local Government."

scopecontent.p: Drafts of 6 articles: 1) Economic Growth; 2) Public Finance; 3) Education; 4) Housing; 5) Health; and 6) Civil Defense (fall-out shelters).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Article by NAR: "Purpose and Policy," (five areas of foreign policy: 1) negotiations with Soviet Union; 2) military security; 3) arms control; 4) economic goals; and 5) values.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

Final draft memo to NAR from Hugh Morrow has NAR handwritten note: "Hugh, Wonderful. Many Thanks! Nelson." Correspondence with Delhi Univ. professor on manuscript being readied for publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

Kissinger; drafts; correspondence; NAR handwritten notes to Ann (Whitman) and edits; Hugh Morrow 12/27/67 memo to NAR (with article reprints) on which NAR writes "Hugh, Many thanks for all you did on this! I think it came out very well."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of files on 49 speeches made by Governor Rockefeller from 1960 to 1964, which is only a small portion of the many speeches he made during this period. Folders 59 through 69 contain speeches made prior to the Republican National Convention of 1960. Speeches in folders 81 through 102 provide an indication of Rockefeller's ambition to seek the Republican Presidential nomination in 1964. The contents of each file vary and may include handwritten drafts by Rockefeller, typed drafts with Rockefeller's handwritten edits, printed transcripts for press releases, and correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included in subseries 3 are memoranda to Rockefeller from Henry A. Kissinger, written for the 1964 campaign for the Republican presidential nomination, giving advice on Yemen, Cuba, Laos, Viet-Nam, NATO, and "California (primary) Strategy" (folders 108, 114, and 120). Also included is a letter to Rockefeller from Edward Teller suggesting the use of "small nuclear explosives" for defense (folder 120) and five other papers on foreign policy written by Teller and forwarded to Rockefeller by Henry Kissinger (folder 126). There are also several memos from Roswell "Rod" B. Perkins to Rockefeller regarding research and advice on various issues. Perkins was an attorney who served as Counsel to Governor Rockefeller for his first six months in office. He was actively involved in Rockefeller's early campaigns as a researcher and advisor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Itinerary; memos Henry A. Kissinger to NAR re "Phoenix Study," "Yemen Conflict"; memos Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins to NAR with "whistle-stop" material, civil rights, combating crime, ethics and conflicts of interest, Johnson's Eastern Europe speech; memo from Oren Root re campaign strategy; memo from Dr. William Ronan with draft of speech on Fiscal Integrity; intinerary for 5/22. Pamphlet; Economic Highlights of California, 1/17/64.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Campaign brochure, large magazine size (3 copies).

Taft, Nelson A. Rockefeller, Barry Goldwater." -Pamphlet, 1966; "The Massive Rockefeller Record." -Reprint, "Foreign Affairs," January, 1968, "Policy and the People." -Reprint, "Tax Policy," March-April, 1968, "Revitalizing the States." -Magazine, "Catalyst for Environmental Quality," Fall, 1970, "Environmental Crises Demand Worldwide Action" by NAR. -Magazine, "The Saturday Evening Post," Summer, 1971, "The Arts and Quality of Life" by NAR. -Magazine, "New York," (1971?), "The Aurelio Perplex..." Mention of NAR in article about Deputy Mayor Richard Aurelio and possibility of Mayor Lindsay running for President in 1972.

Section on pre-1964 positions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Governor's copy; 2 sections: Domestic and Foreign.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sections on: Best Issues, Extreme Positions, Summary of Record, Domestic Issues, Foreign Issues, and Miscellaneous; some NAR notes on loose copies of material in back of book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1/30/64 memo Henry Kissinger to NAR re Cuba 3/19/64 original letter from Edward Teller to NAR re California Campaign with emphasis on "deterioration of North Atlantic Treaty Organization" and need for a "joint North Atlantic Treaty Organization effort toward a defense against ballistic missiles," and the use of "small nuclear explosives which are required for defense." 3/23/64 Confidential letter, Charley Moore (Chair (?) of "Rockefeller for President") to NAR, re need for a "miracle" to win nomination; suggested changes in campaign which might provide "miracle," and allow NAR to survive loss. 4/24/64 memo from Wes Willoughby to NAR re "Goldwater, the Extreme Right wing and the California G.O.P."; list of "Extremists on Goldwater Delegation"; "Extremists" on Goldwater Kickoff Dinner Committee (including "Ronald Reagan, wants to repeal income tax"); John Birch Society information. 3/5/64 Henry Kissinger to NAR re "The Situation in Laos" (recent coup d'etat). 5/12/64 Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins to NAR re Senator Kuchel analysis of 25 Goldwater votes. 5/13/64 Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins to NAR re Henry Kissinger draft of statement on Malaysia. 5/13/64 Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins to NAR re Henry Kissinger statement on Cuba. 5/21/64 Henry Kissinger to NAR (original) memo re "Available Statements" on Cuba, Malaysia, Middle East, North Atlantic Treaty Organization, Defense, Zanzibar, Vietnam, Statement on Administration Philosophy, and Union of the Free. 5/21/64 Henry Kissinger to NAR (original) memo re "California Strategy." 1963 "Christmas Presents" list of names.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Press release 7/18/63 re enforcement of laws prohibiting discrimination; Conference Memo 1/6/84 Minister's Committee on Job Opportunities in Brooklyn; follow-up memo to NAR from Alexander Aldrich.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 9/6/63 Memo Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins to NAR re 6/17/60 Civil Rights speech annotated "to show which proposals have been picked up by John F. Kennedy." 9/30/63 Memo Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins to NAR: "Cut-Off of Federal Funds to States Practicing Discrimination." 10/21/63 Memo Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins to NAR: "Handling of Civil Rights Issues." Copies of Positions memos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memo by Keith S. McHugh, Commissioner of Commerce re improvement of business climate in New York 1959-1969.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Press release from American Bankers Association 2/25/63; memo T. N. Hurd to NAR re Gross National Product (GNP) and capital expenditures; memo John Deardourff to NAR re growth rate in United States and Europe; Chase Manhattan charts on business outlook and interest rates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Background memo from Division of Budget; NAR handwritten notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 12/23/63 memo to Henry A. Kissinger to NAR with draft of speech; 12/27/63 memo from Henry A. Kissinger to NAR forwarding five papers by Edward Teller which Teller says grew out of conversations with NAR. Henry A. Kissinger says "I do not think we can use them in their present form. However, there are some ideas in them that we may be able to work into individual statements." The five papers are entitled: 1) The Need for Criticism; 2) On Defense; 3) The Union of the Free; 4) New Roots for Freedom; 5) On Russia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Goldwater quotes notebook (excerpts), some with NAR handwritten notes; Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins memos to NAR; Henry A. Kissinger memo re Tactical Nuclear Weapons in Europe (10/29/63); George Hinman re Goldwater statement "called...to our attention by Meade Alcorn"; news clippings re Goldwater.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: NAR telegram to Goldwater re: congratulations and invitation to debate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Confidential memo to NAR from Victor Borella re amendment to the Davis-Bacon Act to include judicial review of wage determinations made by the Secretary of Labor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Undated handwritten notes by NAR re "Transferability of Pensions."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Confidential memo Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins to NAR, includes advice on rationalizing shift in position.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: NAR handwritten notes on strategy, principles, philosophy, approach, etc. 1963 memo from Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins re July, 1963 meeting to discuss securing nomination for President in 1964; 13 handwritten pages by NAR about "Identification with Party." slogans, defense of freedom, prevention of monopoly of power, policies, etc., 12/13/63 "Important 'Image' Elements" memo for New Hampshire Primary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memo from Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins to NAR re Act and summary of its first 5 years.

did.unittitle: New Hampshire - Polls and General Issues

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memos from Lloyd Free with results of polls; memo from Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins: End each speech by asking for vote; NAR handwritten (and typed) notes 11/63 on issues; 12/13/63 memo on New Hampshire issues; memos from Lloyd Free profiling New Hampshire voters and latest (12/26/63) poll; undated NAR handwritten speech outline.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Undated "Running-while-behind" notes (handwritten and typed ) for statement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Background materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copies of Treaty; 10/9/63 memo from Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins to NAR with recap.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memo 11/4/63 from Henry A. Kissinger to NAR re mentioning, in criticisms of Kennedy Administration, "Opening to the Left"; signifies Italian Government attempt "to wean the Left Wing Socialists away from a coalition with the Communists and make them a part of the Government."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 12/29/63 statement by William E. Walsh accepting State Chair of NAR campaign.

did.unittitle: Per Capita Income, Taxes, Expenditures (by State)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Charts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: NAR acceptance of Republican nomination for Governor, 8/25/58; Recommendation of the (New York) Republican Platform Advisory Committee, 8/25/58; NAR: "A Republican Approach to Great Issues" (7/11/60); Speech, 6/7/62, of Melvin R. Laird in House of Representatives: "A Declaration of Republican Principle and Policy"; Press release, 9/19/62, NAR acceptance speech accepting gubernatorial nomination.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of NAR major speeches 1959-1963, with copies of some speeches and digests; arranged in chronological order by year, but years are in reverse order as per memo dated 10/25/63 from John Deardourff to NAR.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Digest of 1958 University of Minnesota study: "Do Republican Leaders Really represent Republicans?"; digest of NAR statement 11/14/61 re Nuclear Testing and Nuclear Test Ban; digest of NAR statement 4/29/63 re Kennedy Administration Failures; 7/7/63 "Minneapolis Tribune" story: "Young GOP Convention 'Mob Rule' Elects Goldwater People"; 9/7/63 memo from Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins' office re NAR positions on foreign aid and "list of our allies who have been confused by our foreign policy..."; 10/24/63 memo on Goldwater and the United Nations; digest of 10/12/63 Nixon "Saturday Evening Post" article "Khrushchev's Hidden Weakness"; Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins memo re 3 proposed amendments to United States Constitution: 1) Amendment Procedure, 2) State Legislature Apportionment (would overrule United States Supreme Court decision Baker v. Carr (one man-one vote)), 3) create "Court of the Union" to review Supreme Court decisions relating to rights reserved to the States; Roswell B. "Rod" Perkins memo (undated) to NAR re Notre Dame Speech Proposal on Compulsory Arbitration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Press release, 10/27/61, speech to National Convention of Sigma Delta Chi; Press release, 1/30/62, Special Message to Legislature on Mental Disability; Press release, 10/14/63, Buffalo speech to United Steelworkers Workmen's Compensation Committee; Press release, 10/23/63, San Francisco, speech to League of California Cities; May 16, 1964 news clippings re Oregon primary victory; draft of editorial for "Los Angeles (?) Times."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Poverty; Civil Rights; Blighted Areas; Education; Job Opportunity; Housing; Law Enforcement; Health; Mental Health; Youth; The Aging; The Environment; Recreation; The Arts; Agriculture; Transportation; Consumer Protection; Government spending & Economic Resources; The Federal System; The American Indian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: History 1954-1963; United States Programs since 1964-Military; United States Programs since 1964-Pacification; United States Programs after 1964-Creation of a National Government.

did.unittitle: Domestic Problems of United States, Statistical Workbook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Staff Report for Republican Governors' Association Policy Committee (Working Document); NAR Chair of Policy Committee; on copy of letter transmitting Workbook to Governor Love, NAR handwritten note: "Ann, I want to get copies of this book for my brothers, my children and all nieces and nephews."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Balance of Payments, Berlin, China, Defense, East-West Trade, Eastern Europe, European Economic Community, Middle East, North American Treaty Organization, Union of Soviet Socialist Republics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memo to NAR from Dr. Hurd re Federal Aid Programs and Taxes; undated "Washington Post" editorial; Statement: "Let the People Speak"; NAR handwritten notes; Republican Governors' Association, Boston, 5/13/68, schedule of witnesses before Regional Platform Hearing; Memo to NAR from Henry A. Kissinger, 6/9/68, "Where Are We Now in the Campaign?"; 6/9/68 Minutes of 'Meeting on National Needs after the [Robert] Kennedy Assassination' with John Gardner, Caryl Haskins and HK (Nancy Maginess took notes); Guest list, Rockefeller Dinner, 6/12/68 (California ?); NAR Schedule for June 17, 1968, New York, Pennsylvania & District of Columbia; NAR Schedule June 18-22, 1968, New York, Cleveland, District of Columbia, Virginia, Delaware; Memo from Keith S. McHugh, 6/13/68, to all members of Post Vietnam Planning Committee; memo to NAR from Hugh Morrow, 6/27/68, re proposed speech on Conventional Arms; "personal" letter, 6/27/68, to NAR from Samuel Lubell with advice on campaign issues; 7/2/68 press releases on foreign policy and gun control; copy of speech "Why I Seek the Presidency" with NAR handwritten edits; memo 7/3/68 to NAR from High Morrow re upcoming San Francisco speech on 7/8/68 and copy of speech; 7/3/68 memo to NAR from Joe Canzeri and Ken Hoeck with Hawaii trip information; 7/5/68 speech on opening of campaign headquarters in Hawaii; Hawaii information notebook (brown binder); news clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, photos and catalogues of David Smith sculpture; recommendations by Dorothy Miller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dr. Franz Winkler notes of a meeting on 10/14/70; memos on issues; October 17-30, 1970 schedule; President Nixon letter dated 9/26/70 to NAR with copy of J. Edgar Hoover's "Open Letter to College Students" and copy of Harry Albright's summary of Hoover letter; Alton Marshall 10/70 memo to NAR re Kennedy Airport Expansion; Abe Lavine 10/70 memo to NAR re Correction Officers Demonstration in New York City on 10/13; memos re "Youth Environmental Service"; Jerry Danzig 10/17//70 memo re Puerto Rican floods of early October and appearance by NAR at telethon to benefit flood relief; speech 10/22/70 for Council on the Arts grant award, with information from the Council on the award; ron Maiorana 10/20/70 memos (2) to NAR for "New York Times" "debate-interview," first memo on "random thoughts," and second on the "ground rules"; press release (undated) from New York State Department of Labor re employment and unemployment in New York in August, 1970.

did.unittitle: Correspondence with Living Rockefeller Family Members (CLOSED FOLDER)
